newsitem.title: UK: Rotterdam bunkers quiet, some see prices falling.
newsitem.headline: Rotterdam bunkers quiet, some see prices falling.

text.p: Rotterdam and Antwerp bunker prices were little changed in very quiet trade on Monday, with volume totalling only about 10,000 tonnes, dealers said.
"We are waiting for prices to drop further. OPEC production is continuing to rise and it's a weak time of year for the bunker market anyhow, so prices are bound to go down," one dealer said.
Rotterdam 380 cst was priced at about $85 a tonne, with 180 cst at $90. Antwerp prices were about the same to $1 above Rotterdam.

The Mediterranean was also little changed from Friday in a generally slow market, dealers said. Piraeus 380 cst was at $89/91 and 180 cst some $6 higher. Fos 380 cst was priced at $91 and 180 cst at $97.
Fujairah 380 cst was likewise steady with 380 cst at $96/100 and 180 cst at $102/104.
